content: stitches along the edge of the heel flap you may want to pick up an extra stitch in the gap between the heel flap and the top of the foot place your first gusset marker knit 28/32/36 stitches across the top of the foot place your second gusset marker if you picked up an extra stitch in the gap on the first side do the same here pick up 15/17/19 stitches along the other edge of the heel flap knit to the middle stitch on the bottom of your heel turn splitting the stitches between your markers in half place a third marker to indicate the new beginning of the round knit one round to secure your pick-up stitches you re now ready to start the gusset decreases row 1 k to 3 stitches before the first gusset marker k2tog k1 sm knit across the top of the foot sm k1 ssk k to the beginning of the round at the bottom of the heel row 2 k to first gusset marker sm knit across the top of the foot sm k to the beginning of the round at the bottom of the heel repeat row 1 & 2 until you have 28/32/36 stitches across the bottom of the foot remove the beginning of the round marker at the bottom of the heel and knit to the first gusset marker this is your new beginning of the round remove the gusset markers as you come to them foot continue knitting in the round until the foot is 2 shorter than the total foot length toe row 1 k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before the end of the row k2tog k1 row 2 knit all stitches repeat row 1 & 2 until you have 14/16/18 stitches on each needle cut the yarn leaving a long tail kitchener stitch to finish the toe weave in your ends and wash and block let s connect email instagram ravelry youtube foundation socks ©2025 rachel coffman 3
